author: jonlief79
title: Decentralized Trading and Finance
description: No way exists for decentralized trading of physical goods, and businesses rely entirely on central financial services for global commerce.

f6_assessments.q0: The project's approach to the problem is consistent with the B2B B2C challenge. I strongly agree with your ideas but it would be more complete if you could clearly show how this project will add value to Cardano? Example build a place that can attract 10 million USD locked in your protocol.
f6_assessments.q1: I recommend it to increase your success when you apply for funds, it is advisable to have more details about members so that the certificate can be checked on affiliate restrictions. Also during the software development phase, the community will be able to more easily visualize what you do when adding the details for the star development software, each piece that forms when building on the Cardano blockchain.
f6_assessments.q2: The project provides a clear development roadmap, each milestone will be achieved on the roadmap, I completely agree with this plan. However, I suggest that your project should have a code update page on GitHub so that the community can easily see how far you are making and also increase transparency for the project.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal starts with a clear description of the team’s mission to address the existing challenge. One of the good points that can be pointed out is that they explain some technical terms, which helps the community better comprehend their solution. They also give a brief introduction of who they are (Comodi), identify their target audience (small farmers), and analyze the problems they are encountering. Based on these findings, they offer a detailed solution including main features (commercial B2B/B2C and private C2B/C2C) and the core functionalities followed up. This section is well written in a logical order, ensuring the clarity and soundness of the solution.
The main challenges are well foreseen in each type of user. They properly offer further strategies with expected efficiency for mitigating these issues, proving their proactivity in risk management. The community may take this into consideration when assessing this proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
They successfully mention two main focuses of their project at the present time as well as their positive impacts on the Cardano ecosystem. A detailed roadmap goes with a reasonable financial plan is provided. As they presented, their activities for the first 270 days of the implementation process will be broken down into 2 principal phases including development and operation. The specific tasks in each phase are also plausibly split with a compatible budget. This will help the community smoothly track the rate of progress and determine the rationale of their spending. 
The team members are properly described with their backgrounds, main roles, and relevant working experience needed for the smooth implementation and development of the project. They also give a short description of their currently used technology to help viewers better visualize their team capacity in this project. Past sample works of the team are additionally provided for references
f6_assessments.q2: The primary KPIs with specific acquired numbers are proposed for better assessments of their project’s success. These indicators are well aligned with the key metrics of the challenge setting, proving that they know really well what they are doing and are very serious about it. Their definition of the project’s success is also very clear, proven by particular successful metrics with realistic numbers to ensure the project’s attainability. All this information will be useful for the community in the tracking and evaluation process, generating more accurate assessments.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal aims at creating a decentralized marketplace for businesses and consumers to purchase, sell and trade physical agriculture commodities on the blockchain using a low fee model to make it affordable to small farmers. The proposer emphasized the problem that small farmers are facing is that they couldn’t compete fairly with Big Ag and their powerful lobbyists in advertising for their products. Also the corporation between farmland and retail grocery pushed them out of the market and faced bankruptcy, and foreclosure.Therefore, they are in an urgent need of having a platform with a low cost of sales unlike the existing one such as eBay, Amazon,,...with a high cost up to 15% cost of sale. This project is an ideal solution for them by providing an alternative platform with a low fee - less than 1% per transaction and a lot of benefits that the blockchain technology has to offer. Therefore, it could be seen that this proposal succeeded in realizing smaller farmers’ needs and providing them a feasible solution based on Cardano, which is aligned with part of the challenge required. However, it is better if they determine the needs of businesses as well, what businesses are looking for, and why this solution would be beneficial for them. The proposal included details about the description of the suggested solution, functions of the proposed products, but didn't present how this solution has an impact on the development of the Cardano ecosystem. It mentioned two main challenges which are related to commercial users and private ones in the process of operating this project with an explanation on how to overcome them over time.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal lacked a detailed plan with a clear and step-by-step timeline of what to do to operate this project successfully. It just mentioned that this project would focus on two-user profiles and how it impacts the Cardano ecosystem. However, in the section listing a budget breakdown, it mentioned the budget distributed in each phase of the project, which is highly evaluated. It would be better if they would create a detailed plan based on every period listed on the budget allocation plan so that everything could be synchronized and easy to understand.The proposal did a great job in listing all important people to ensure the success of this project. An outstanding person taking part in this project is founder Lief Olson who used to work in the organic farming field. He has contacts and experience in running businesses in this field. He would be fully aware of the purpose of this project and lead the team in the right direction to achieve the final result. Besides, the developer team has high expertise and experience in blockchain development. One highlight here is that the proposal presented a recently coded smart contract that was highly evaluated by a community of developers and crypto professionals. It also had some talks with some farming organizations in the USA, Colombia, South America with positive beliefs about its potential. These are good signals to trust in the feasibility of this project.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer set up KPIs with specific figures for two stages of the project, which is complying with the plan. Besides, it defined how the success looked like by listing detailed successful metrics including the time to get a targeted number. This makes it easy to audit, trace and track the progress of the project. However, it lacked stating whether this is a new proposal or a continuation one that was partly funded.

f6_assessments.q0:
Important notice to voters:
This proposal is very much similar to “Web3 Commerce and Finance dApp” by the same team who are asking for the same amount, for the same project, but written with somewhat different words.
Since the proposals are almost identical, my reviews will naturally also be, since only the wording is different, but the message is the same.
The team is planning a web3, decentralised marketplace where individuals and businesses can buy, sell and trade physical goods with the help of blockchain technology, DeFi, NFTs, smart contracts etc, featuring greater transparency (verifiable ledger), smaller fees (0.5% - influenced by the low cost of transaction fees on Cardano), opportunity (openness of web3 and decentralisation) and reliability (transparency and security of open ledger and smart contracts implementation for each transaction).
The project has the potential to impact the world of commerce, blockchain and Cardano in a favourable way if successfully implemented and adopted by the targeted audience.
f6_assessments.q1:
A timeline and a detailed plan should have also been provided in this section, with the purpose of offering a clear direction and the steps necessary to complete the project. The team has instead provided another generalised description of their main goal and a statement on the proposal’s impact on the Cardano ecosystem, citing some numbers and information, that are not backed up by a source link.
The budget is very well broken-down, with a lot of information provided for clarity, as such, there is no additional requirement from my part.
As for the team members, the provided information is not sufficient to assess their potential in the successful implementation of the project. The proposer should have included a short description, containing skills and previous work for each team member, adding also a (professional) social profile link for verification. Without this information about the team and the detailed plan, I cannot correctly assess the team’s capabilities in implementing the proposal successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposers have provided KPIs for the 2 phases of the progress development, they are succinct, but offer sufficient information. However, it should also have been clearly indicated how these KPIs will be able to be independently verified for implementation by the community. 
The success metrics are well written, are linked to a timeline and are sufficiently detailed, offering a good visualisation of what the team wants to achieve with the project.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea of developing web3 in the exchange of commercial goods and payments with cryptocurrency is an inevitable trend of the civilized world and the progress of blockchain development. Currently, the biggest barrier is the legal issue, so many countries have not yet accepted cryptocurrencies. However, our children and grandchildren will be more open, so this is the best time to grow. Web3 and cryptocurrency payments are obviously more secure, the cost is much cheaper, and the audience is global without any continental restrictions. So this is a project I highly recommend, and hope it has enough funding to go through.
f6_assessments.q1: They are at the stage of market research, technology, business model modeling standards. So this is a stage that requires a lot of practicality, understanding reality and then doing it methodically, for sure. They have a clear plan, according to each timeline, and I also feel the enthusiasm and ambition of this project. Hopefully they will always keep this serious, for a future of widely applying the cardano platform to the web3 online commerce business and payment in cryptocurrency.
f6_assessments.q2: They have a clear numerical target for the number of businesses and users that will participate in this beta. This is a necessary element to verify that the project is serious or not. You should also have a strong communication channel to receive feedback from the cardano community, and customers build from here. We are an open platform, with groups and individuals extremely passionate about cardano.

solution: A web3 marketplace and exchange to buy, sell, and trade physical goods, with built-in tools and Defi protocols designed for business needs.
experience:
Lief Olson- entrepreneur in the agricultural, food & beverage industries, and project manager.
David Kulk- web3 and smart contract developer.
Adam Sabotka- web3 and full stack developer.
